page.title: 01BALDERSTONE AND HOTHERSALL
page.content: These are two completely seperate rural parishes lying to the north and south of the River Ribble. There are no road or bridge links between them. The roads within each area are minor country lanes and cul-de-sacs. there are no villages as such. Habitation is widely scattered and comprises Farmhouses and associated buildings and a sprinkling of individual private dwellings ranging from Old Country Houses and Cottages and a few Houses and Bungalows. The area is agricultural with Dairy Farming and Beef and Sheep Stock Rearing being the main occupation. The terrain is undulating except where it falls steeply in places to the river valley where the land on both sides of the river is mainly flat.
